result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn R Heyrman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 07/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 13 days jail, for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to perform 25 Hours of Community Service within 1 year of today. To be monitored by WCS.

07-14-16, billing statement was billed at incorrect rate, returned to Atty Ponath to submit at correct rate. Was bill at contract rate, should be at SPD rate.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shawn R Heyrman in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court strikes the domestic abuse enhancer and finds defendant guilty. 
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

FINE: $442.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 7/1/16 or serve 13 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).

DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month  consecutive to payment on fine).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 25 Hours within 1 year, to be monitored by WCS.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
From Atty Ponath dated 4/28/16 requesting permission to hire an investigator.

Defendant Shawn R Heyrman in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath received discovery and an offer today in Court.  Attorney Ponath requests time to review discovery.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 02-17-2016 01:30 pm
Defendant to pay: $100 per month commencing 3/1/16.

Defendant Shawn R Heyrman in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has not retained counsel.  The Court instructs the Defendant to complete the Petition for Appointment of Counsel.  The Court recalls the case with the same appearances.  The Defendant is sworn in and testifies.  The Court finds the Defendant is eligible for representation and will appoint an attorney for the Defendant at the repayment rate of $100.00 per month commencing 3/1/16.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
